meanings.definition: To bewitch or cast a spell on someone using voodoo practices.
meanings.sent1: The witch voodooed the doll to bring harm to her enemy.
meanings.sent2: She voodooed the potion to make her crush fall in love with her.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat voodooed the toy mouse to scare its owner.
meanings.sent4: The magician voodooed the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The old book voodooed anyone who dared to open its pages.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or control someone or something as if by magic.
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer voodooed the king into doing his bidding.
meanings.sent2: She voodooed her way into getting the promotion she wanted.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child voodooed the remote control to play pranks on his family.
meanings.sent4: The hypnotist voodooed the minds of the audience with his soothing voice.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious figure voodooed the outcome of the game with a single gesture.
